list.ptitle: IIIF Services and Tools Introduction and Welcome
list.slides: files/IIIF TaNC Webinar1 - S01 01 - Jpadfield -  Introduction.pdf

list.comment: What goes into providing IIIF for millions of items? Or even a National Collection? Tom Crane looks at large-scale IIIF implementation, with particular focus on Wellcome Collection.
Abira Hussein will be exploring the challenges faced, and the potential for IIIF to support more independent community-based archives to exist digitally and sustainability online.

list.ptitle: 'Could it help us to...?': The Royal Collection and IIIF
list.comment: Andrew Davis  will present a paper centred around  how focusing on small-scale, tangible benefits set The Royal Collection Trust on the path to IIIF adoption.

list.ptitle: IIIF, Linked Open Data, and Crowdsourcing a the National Library of Wales
list.comment: Jason Evans will present details of how IIIF has facilitated larger endeavours at the National Library of Wales.

list.ptitle: IIIF Services and Tools: Session 1 Questions
Davy Verbeke (University of Ghent) - MADOC & Congo Comics
Andrew Prescott (Univeristy of Glasgow) - IIIF Manuscripts and Archives
Mia Ridge (British Library) - IIIF British Library Viewer and Manifests
Mary-Ann Constantine (University of Wales) - IIIF, 18<sup>th</sup> Century Literature & Culture
Pia Eckhart (University of Freiburg) - IIIF and Medieval Annotations
Ben Bakelaar (Human Experience Systems LLC) - Thomas Edison Papers & Vatican Film Library
